content: SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE. The "Census Address List Improvement Act of 1994" requires local governments to review and submit address information to the Secretary for the development of a national address list before the decennial census date. The Census Address List Improvement Act of 1994 mandates local governments to submit address information for review by the Bureau. The Bureau will provide determinations and reasons for their decisions, subject to a review process. The Administrator of the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs will develop an appeals process for States and local governments to appeal Census Bureau determinations. The Chief Statistician will publish the proposed process for public comment before finalizing it. Additionally, the United States Postal Service will be authorized to share address lists. The Postal Service will provide address information to the Secretary of Commerce for Census Bureau use, in accordance with mutually agreeable terms.
